snippet: Prosecutors on Friday recommended four years in prison for former Representative Jesse L. Jackson Jr., after his guilty plea this year on charges that he engaged in a scheme to spend $750,000 in campaign money on personal items.
abstract: Prosecutors recommend four years in prison for former Rep Jesse L Jackson Jr, after his guilty plea on charges that he engaged in scheme to spend $750,000 in campaign money on personal items.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors on Friday recommended four years in prison for former Representative Jesse L. Jackson Jr., after his guilty plea this year on charges that he engaged in a scheme to spend $750,000 in campaign money on personal items.

headline.main: Illinois: Prosecutors Seek Four-Year Term for Jackson
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Prosecutors Seek Four-Year Term For Jackson
